de.unisiegen.tpml.core.interpreters
Interface InterpreterProofModel

All Superinterfaces:
Bean, ProofModel, TreeModel
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractInterpreterProofModel, BigStepProofModel, SmallStepProofModel
public interface InterpreterProofModel
extends ProofModel

Base interface for the big and small step interpreter proof models. It extends the ProofModel interface with functionality to query whether memory operations are enabled during the evaluation of the expression.

Version:
$Rev: 277 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
InterpreterProofNode, ProofModel

Method Detail

isMemoryEnabled

boolean isMemoryEnabled()
Returns true if memory operations, as part of the imperative concepts, are used while proving properties of a program. If memory is enabled, the InterpreterProofNode.getStore() method returns the Store at the given node. Otherwise an invalid - usually empty - store will be returned.

Returns:
true if memory operations are used while evaluating the expression.
See Also:
Store, InterpreterProofNode.getStore()
